item.description:
PLEASE NOTE the guest feature is turned off.  I did this due to limited parking. I have limited the group to 10 CARS. If you have a guests in the same car as you that is fine. If you have guest in their own car they need to RSVP on their own. Due to a shoulder injury I will not be able to help load or unload boats.

PLEASE NOTE - The organizers in this group are NOT trained leaders or instructors.  The organizers only set the time and place, each person participating in any group trip is responsible for their own safety.  Each participant is responsible for evaluating all relevant conditions for the trip and determining if their skills and equipment are appropriate for those conditions.

Suitable to all levels. Please read the discussion on New to Kayaking if you are a new kayaker.

Kayak/Canoe Swift River in Belchertown, MA Saturday June 11, launch at 10:00 AM. This means we will be in our boats at 10:00 AM. Saturday's weather should be beautiful. Bring water and a snack/lunch. You MUST wear your PFD. This is an amazing river to paddle, slow water suitable for all skill levels and types of boats. The area is gorgeous, and for several miles of the river the water is crystal clear, you can see the beautiful formations on the bottom and lots of fish! Plenty of birds everywhere too! We'll be paddling upstream then back down to the launch area for a break. That will be about 1 1/2 hours. For anyone who wants to continue we'll then go downstream then back up to the launch, for about an additional 1 1/2 hours of paddling. Here is a link that shows a map to the boat access area - http://www.mass.gov/d... ------Directions------ If you are coming from the north, please use yahoo maps or mapquest with Cold Spring Road, Belchertown, MA as your destination, that should get you there. I also recommend looking at the map in the link above. The boat launch is on Cold Sping Road between East Street and River Road I go west out of Ware on Rt 9 and take a left on River Road or East Street. These roads go along the river down to the boat launch. They go off of RT 9 near the entrances for the Quabbin Dam From the Mass Pike – (These directions are from yahoo maps, but modified as their directions are misleading in a few places.) - Take Exit #8 (Palmer) - At the end of the offramp after the toll booth, turn left onto Thorndike St. - In 0.8 miles turn left onto High St. - High St. becomes Church St. - Church St. becomes Pleasant St. - Pleasant St. becomes Thorndike St. - At the end of Thorndike, bear right onto Rt. 181 North. - Turn left onto Depot Road and then right at the end of that street to stay on 181 North (just follow the signs for 181 North and stay with that). - In 1.5 miles, turn RIGHT onto Michael Sears Road (Last time I was there, the street sign was missing, but it's the first right after Franklin St - look at mapquest and it will be pretty clear) - In 1.3 miles, take a sharp right onto Cold Spring Road - In about ½ mile, you’ll see a sign that says “Swift River Access” on the right at the entrance to the parking area. If you go over the river, you missed it. (The parking area is just after you pass East St. on the left.) LOOK AT The MAP.  If you take 181 you can continue straight when 181 crosses the river in Palmer and continue up the side of the river to the boat launch. I do not know the name of the street but it is so much easier.
item.name: Swift River in Belchertown, MA
